Posts.Content: BlazerFan wrote: Hello,    Three weeks ago I went in for my annual exam and when they did my breast exam the doctor found a lump. She said it was more like a thickening of the tissue, could't feel any real definative borders but was about 2cm by 2cm, and said to make another appointment after my next period. So I made the appointment with another doctor (for insurance reasons) and that was this morning. She said it didn't feel like a cyst and was guessing because of my age (23 almost 24) it was probably a fibroadenoma. She said if it was cancer it would probably have doubled in size from my last appointment which I told her was about a month ago. I told her it was 2 cm by 2 cm then and when she measure it this morning it was 2.5 cm by 4cm. She said that was concerning and now I am going to have a biopsy next week. My mom had cancer so I do have a family history. I'm trying so hard not to be worried but it's hard waiting! Does anyone think there is a chance that this is cancer because of how fast it is growing... even if I'm only 23?? Thanks for you support... it's been great reading these boards. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Trying not to be scared! BlazerFan leaf

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 12:13AM BlazerFan wrote: Thanks for the reply... it's good to know that 80% of biopsies are not cancer. I am wondering though... is it common for fibroidenomas to grow that fast?
Posts.Title: Trying not to be scared! BlazerFan leaf
